I had to add salt and pepper to bring out some flavor. The rice noodles were mushy (wayyyyy over cooked) and there was barely any meat. Who knew Thai could be flavorless? The place was nice and clean and the staff was attentively, but that's not enough to bring me back. #ontothenextone

I absolutely love this place!!!! Been here over a dozen times. I've tried a few dishes but I keep going back for the curries. I have NEVER been disappointed once eating here. The staff is great, the service is quick and you will leave stuffed. Love!!!
This is my goto spot for Thai food in Charlotte.  Fresh food and great team.  I highly recommend!!
The food was very good. The pud gra pow was very authentic and delicious. The portions are a good size for lunch and it came with a choice of salad or soup and a spring roll.Excellent Thai food.

Reliable, not over crowded and service is impeccable. The sushi is a little heavy on the rice, but it came out fast and fresh. I highly recommend getting one of their sake beverages. Kids all seem to like the fried rice/tempura choices and they make a mean Shirley temple!

Great selection and service. We were sat quickly and staff helped me stash my husbands crutches while we ate. Everything was delicious, although I was disappointed to bite into cilantro in my crab dish as it wasn't listed on the menu and I can't stand the taste. Will be back to try more dishes next time a Thai craving strikes.

Where to start-I guess with my repeat order of the Thom Ka soup and the chicken wings-the chicken soup is made with coconut milk, lemon grass and cilantro and is topped with a spicy red oil that really opened my sinuses. The chicken wings are crisp and served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. 

They always have special sushi offerings that are fresh and are served beautifully on long white platters. We also have had sashimi and it has also been fresh and beautifully sliced. 

Casual dress, private parking lot, give this one a try when you are in the Ballantyne area.

An overall decent experience here.  I always get the pad kee mao...and forget that they do not ever give enough noodles.  I need to ask for extra next time.  The favor is good, spice level 4, although next time I will try 5.  They serve a little tray with 5 different sauces, which I hadn't experienced before. Very delicious! Try the green one..yum! Very spicy though.  I had mango sticky rice for dessert..they used a green tea rice?! Why? I don't know because it was honestly disgusting.  Yuck! Days later I can still taste the grossness.  Please use white rice!

The service was good. Good sweet tea. Friendly and fast waitress.  The food come out very quickly which is great! The sushi was pretty good too.
My favorite dishes are the stir fry clam, stir fry lobster, stir fry beef with oyster sauce! Bahn Thai roll is yummy to!

I've worked in Ballantyne for a few years and never knew this place existed, but am glad I found it now! Went in for lunch and the place was packed, seeming to be a hot spot for business lunches. 

The server was very quick to take my order and brought me a delightful cup of their "house soup". I don't know what it was exactly, but it seemed like a spin on a chicken and rice. It was a tasty start to he meal. As for lunch, I went with the 2 sushi rolls and that did not disappoint. The sushi was very fresh and made to order. Each lunch dish also comes with a spring roll and it was just the right amount of crispyness to go with the light lunch. 

This is definitely a place that I will be returning to for many lunches in the future.

I went there for lunch.  The waitress obviously did not know the menu.  The dish she explained was not what I received.  A runner brought the food out and when the waitress came by soon after.  You could see the " I got that wrong" expression on her face.  She immediately started asking if she could get me something else.  The food was ok, the portion was tiny and it was way over priced.  Starting with better service, this could be a good place.

Bahn Thai serves the best Thai food in Charlotte. We have been to this restaurant several times and the food is very consistent and always delicious. The service is excellent. The Panang Curry and Pud Gra Pow dishes are my favorite. I also like the Pud Thai and Green Curry dishes. I look forward to my next visit.
Amazing authentic Thai food and super friendly staff! Casual place, come as you are. My favorite Thai spot in town. I've been there at least 20 times and never disliked anything I've ordered.

Authentic, filling, best all around place that I have been to in the Charlotte area when it comes to Thai food. You will be glad you stopped in and your stomach will thank you as well. If you want a different experience, sit at the bar and watch them make the sushi rolls. Such an art to the preparation and it comes out so nice. Enjoy it

Very rude staff, very poor service. 

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

HORRIBLE! If I could give this place a -5, I would! I walk in at 9pm to a server shouting across the restaurant, are you ordering to-go (Not hello, welcome, HI)! I replied, yes, I guess. He replied, "We close at 9:15", I said "Oh, your sign says 9:30 as I take a seat", Server "Yea, but we close at 9:15, so we can go home at 9:30", Me "Oh, I work in the industry and I never heard of a business doing that", Some guy sitting at the bar (appeared to be a manager) interrupts conversation and states "If you don't like our policy you can leave". ME "Ok". Walked out, now wonder why the place was empty. As, I walked out I noticed how dirty and un-kept the restaurant was and I thought it was a sign that maybe I should not have eaten there. If a business wants to close at 9:15, then put 9:15 on the door. Granted I was close to closing, but 30 minutes away for someone who was just ordering a single take-out dish did not warrant this treatment. Ended up going across the street to Midwood, having a great dinner and leaving $20 tip ($19 check) to a great service experience!

What thai is it? It's THAI TIME!!! Thai food is amongst my favorites of cuisines. A bite of any of the dish at Banh Thai will have you tasting the exoticness of Thailand right here in North Carolina. How much better can it get?! Our waitress was very friendly, and the service was great. The only thing I would change is the lack of variety on the menu. There aren't a whole lot of options when it comes to the curry dishes. They are each delicious nonetheless! :)

This was our first time here and were pleasantly surprised that we had a choice of tables on a Labor Day Saturday night at 6pm. Very clean and quiet atmosphere.  Our waitress was attentive regarding dietary issues for two in our party. That worked out well. 

The appetizers of fried calamari and tempura shrimp were excellent although for four guests there could have been more of each. The crispy duck was excellent per two guests. I had the pineapple fried rice with shrimp. Excellent, not greasy and an abundant serving.  My wife had the Pud Thai with chicken
with no complaints. 

I had forgotten to look for the beautiful lobster roll with sushi & tempura pictured here elsewhere. I'll have that next time.  

All in all a good visit with more to come.

I came here with my husband and have found my new favorite Thai restaurant. After moving to Charlotte from Atlanta, I've been on the hunt for a good Thai place. One that is tasty and authentic and makes your mouth water each time you think of it. I'd read the reviews on Yelp, and was a little skeptical, but they definitely lived up to the words people were saying. I can't remember exactly what we had, but I can say everything is good. Next time I visit, I will write another review and give the names of the dishes. I'm sure that will be helpful to first time visitors! Enjoy this place :-)
Stopped by for lunch while in south Charlotte for work. Nothing spectacular, but was a good choice for something different for lunch with coworkers. Tried the Pad Thai.

Excellent!!! Had Thom Kha shrimp soup - as good as I've had anywhere, and the shrimp was so tender, not overcooked and rubbery like most places.  The Gaeng Panang curry was equally great.  Very clean, great vibe, great service.  Can't find a single negative about tonight's visit!

The true test of a Thai restaurant for me is their Pad See Ew. Why? Because, if it's good, I will order it each time I return. If it's not good, I won't go back. Well, unless their sticky rice is to die for!

This place failed in their sticky rice, but, the Pad See Ew was spot on. Perfectly chewy noodles with a liberal dose of egg doused in a slurpy sauce makes this my new go to Thai place. Glad we moved so close to this gem. 

Some of their seafood specials looked worth deviating from the pad see ew. Some day.

Visiting from LA. You wouldn't think they would have amazing sushi in North Carolina but man the food was so amazing. Really top quality meat. Server was really nice. And the saki was amazing. Next time we're here we will definitely return.

Solid Thai food place. Staff is friendly. Food is scrumptious! Prices are alright. Best deal is the lunch special which I highly recommend (Starting at $9). You get your order, rice (brown or jasmine) and a spring roll. Soups are on point!

I got the Gaeng Keow Wan, which is green curry in coconut milk with peas, carrots, and eggplant. I thought the eggplant was mistakenly beef and I didn't eat it. I had extra vegetables and tofu as my protein. The dish was very flavorful. I would like to try the Gaeng Karee next.

I also had the Thom Kha soup, coconut milk with onions, scallions, mushrooms, herbs and dried chili.. And I got mine with extra vegetables- broccoli, carrots, bamboo shoots, etc. The soup is $5. I always get Thom Kha soup or a variation of it to compare with other Thai restaurants.

This restaurant stacks up very well. With that being said, price is higher end but definitely worth it. Great quality, friendly staff, great ambience and decor. 

Would I return? Yes.

I mostly come here for the sushi. Spicy tuna roll and crunchy shrimp roll are my favorite. Aside from the sushi, Pud Thai is also very good. I've never dined in, but the sushi counter is a great place to hang out and nibble if you're alone (I enjoyed chatting while I waited for my sushi.) LOVE that the sushi chef is a lady, too--very rare!

BF was craving Thai food, amazing how many Thai places closed on Mondays. Based on Yelp reviews we decided to check out Bahn Thai.. it did not disappoint. We started with the spring rolls, they were crispy, fresh and served with a nice dipping sauce, order came with 4, we could have easily eaten 8 especially since I only had the opportunity to eat 1 and a half!. For dinner I ordered Pud Kee Mow level 3 spicy with chicken. Noodles were perfectly cooked, generous amount of chicken and fresh veggies and not overly loaded with sauce. I like things spicy and the level 3 gave a good kick. BF ordered Ped Met Ma Muang level 5 spicy with beef... also excellent, as with my dish generous amounts of beef, fresh veggies and not overly loaded with sauce. We didnt notice much different between the level 3 and level 5 spicy so the BF would have liked it hotter. We both ended up with leftovers to take home and mine was even better the next day... the thai basil flavor really shone thru on the leftovers. I have already told two friends about this place and look forward to going back.

Always have great food and experience here. Been there few times for lunch and dinner. Their tempuras are awesome - crispy without being greasy.  The basil fried rice is near perfect and flavorful.  Service is always good.  Definitely recommend.

I was in town from Maryland over the Christmas break and was craving Thai food. I read reviews for a bunch of places and talked my inlaws into trying this place. I was a little nervous it wouldn't meet my expectations, but it exceeded them. Everything was good, from the spring rolls to the pad Thai to the red curry (which was my favorite). My husband and inlaws loved it as well. The waitress helped with recommendations and provided a spice tray so we could experiment which I loved. It will definitely become a tradition when we are in town!

I grabbed take-out here a couple days ago, 3 dishes - vegetable red curry (11.95), tofu pad thai (10.95), and tofu pad kee mow (10.95).  I asked them to have it ready for pickup at 6:20.  They were very friendly and spoke clear English on the phone (a nice plus) and my food was ready as soon as I got there!  The food was very good, no complaints.  I feel for the price point that the food is at, it is a 4 star restaurant.  I will definitely return to try more dishes.

So I left a review a long time ago for take out and I can't believe I haven't updated it. Bahn Thai is still just as amazing! It ended up turning a once week spot for lunch every week for almost a year! Pineapple fried rice is amazing! Gaeng Mussamun is also amazing. Almost everything on that lunch menu is amazing. Even their Japanese food options and sushi is great! Ask for Mary! She's great!!

I love me some Thai food and I mean LOVE!  I've been to Bahn Thai to eat in and for take out.  The service while dining in was excellent. The food was good as well. I had chicken cashew and it had great flavor. Thai tea was also good. Then we decided to try mango and sweet , sticky rice. My first time trying this and it was great!  Who would think something so simple would be so tasty. I've also had Pad Thai here and it was good as well. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the wait for take out was pretty long. They told us about 15-20 minutes. It was more like 30-45. Definitely could've been worse but it was around 1 on a weekday and not very busy. Still food is great and the staff has always been very friendly.

I love Banh Thai's food so it hurts me to only give them 3 stars.  The food is always 100% but the staff could be a little more attentive.  Also, I've watched parties wait 5+ minutes to be sat, while staff walks right by them.  That's only happened to me once and I almost walked out... just not sure why that happens at all.

Best Pad Thai I've ever had, also their eel rolls is amazing I believe is called the Rock and Roll Eel!  But you MUST, MUST try their pad thai the noodles are thinner than your traditional places but their spice and blend of flavors will simply leave you addicted.
This place is awesome! I suggest the Ballantyne sushi roll. But everything is great, and the place is clean and a bit small but it doesn't get too crowded to feel comfortable.
Great Thai Food. Pud Thai they call it here, not Pad Thai. I love it!
Their Pud Thai is ridiculously good. Just went for the first time tonight, and we will definitely be back.

Amazing friendly atmosphere and excellent service! I ordered chicken vegetable soup and loved it, vegetables were  prepared just right lightly cooked fresh and crispy. We also ordered pad sew ew with chicken. Dish was very tender, light and flavorful sauce, crisply vegetates. Definitely a place to go back to!

Surprisingly delicious Thai is happening down in Ballantyne! We stopped in after a crazy day around town, ravenous and hopeful.

We ordered some bottled beers and set to work on the menu. We ordered noodle dishes and were both pleased with our choices. My Pud Kee Mow was smoky and spicy (but not too spicy). The Mr's Pud See Ew was equally well-executed and satisfying.

Our server was delightful and talked us into the mango and sticky rice dessert. Simple, not overtly sweet, and the perfect finale to a fantastic dinner experience.

I'd recommend checking out Bahn Thai on a date night before catching a movie at the Ballantyne Village Theatre, or after a pre-dinner glass of wine at Cr√º Wine Shop close by.

Went with the traditional Thai and saw some recommendations for the Pud See-Ew and went vegetables and hold the egg.  Pretending a nearly maybe vegan dish. ;-)    Dish came out hot and well seasoned at a 2 out of 5 spicey was perfect for me.  Very flavoraful, crisp cooked vegetables and rice noodles not "starchy" and gooey, but we'll cooked but firm.  Good job.

Great find!  This place is small but they turn tables well.  The food portions were huge.  We all had leftovers.  We tried to pud Thai and fried rice.  Everything had a nice flavor.   The wings were perfect and crispy.  You can ask for your level of hot for certain dishes.  Will be back and looking forward to trying other dishes.

This place is a hidden gem!   Discovered Bahn Thai on yelp and decided to give it a shot.  Best dinner decision we've ever made!  Everything we have tried has been great!  My wife and I came a few times and finally invited my mom and sister and they love it as much as we do.  It is all of our favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  Highly recommend!

Bahn Thai is one of our favorite places to eat in Charlotte. The service is wonderful, the prices are just right and portions perfect. Most importantly, the food is amazing. We drive all the way from Huntersville to dine at this gem.

Was here visiting family for the weekend. My brother suggested we go here for lunch. I ordered the panang curry. It was great! Very filling. The portion size was large. The service was also good. Would definitely come back here when I'm visiting again.

I'm not that adventurous when it comes to Thai food and so everytime I come here i've pretty much gotten the same thing. Which was the 1st dish I tried and liked. I always get the seafood combination as my protein. The food is so fresh!! I decided to venture out recently and tried the Summer Rolls and Thai Tea... not a fan. The summer rolls were dry and boring and the Thai Tea was just weird. So i'll stick to my old faithful from now on which I never have any complaints about.

I've been seeing Julia M check into this place for a while and already heard some good things about the place so I put it on my list of places to check out.

I stopped in for lunch one day.  While it was a pain to get to because of 485 construction, thankfully 485 will hopefully not be under destruction for too much longer and getting here will be a bit easier.

When I arrived, service was a bit slow.  There were 3 servers and a sushi chef behind the bar.  I waited about 10 minutes before anyone acknowledged me to seat me.  Once seated service improved a bit.

Compared to other Thai places that might have 5-8 lunch specials, this place has a bigger lunch menu.  You can order your meal with various types of meats or no meat at all.  You can also opt for brown rice instead of white.  Lunches come with soup or salad and a spring roll.

I went with soup and my standard meal for trying out a new Thai place, Pud Gra Pow which is choice of protein with Thai basil, peppers, carrots in a light sauce.  I also ordered it level 5 on the spice meter.  

The soup was kind of meh.  It consisted of chicken with julienne strips of veggies.  The chicken flavor was overpowering.   The spring roll was chewy instead of crispy and lacked real flavor.   The meal was nicely presented and it tasted wonderful.  The spice level was about a 4 rather than 5 but still decent.

For my first visit I think there were too many flaws to consider this more than 3 star review.  But I will definitely add this to my list of Thai places to return to.

Excellent Thai restaurant!   The red curry chicken was one of the best I've ever had. The restaurant is very clean with a nice atmosphere.  The service was very pleasant.
